channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Movies of 1999
item.description: Twenty-five years ago was a landmark time for cinema, with films that captured our collective hope and paranoia about the coming millennium.

item.title: The Movies of 1999
item.description: Twenty-five years ago was a landmark time for cinema, with films that captured our collective hope and paranoia about the coming millennium.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg gave his ex-Facebook engineer startup advice at 2 a.m. over chess—now she’s a founder with over $8.5 million raised in funding
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg told ex-Facebook intern Sophie Novati: ‘Figure out a way to capture people's valuable attention’.

item.title: Ukraine Destroys Key Russian Bridge as It Presses On With Offensive
item.description: The bridge’s destruction is a setback for Russian supply lines as Ukraine seeks to consolidate its territorial gains in the Kursk region of western Russia.

item.title: A New National Park That Rests on Indigenous and Industrial History
item.description: The collapse of a steel mill project during the Great Depression preserved natural lands linked to First Nations people in Windsor, Ontario.

item.title: European governments are targeting international students to curb surging immigration—but it’s costing universities billions
item.description: In the U.K. alone the total economic benefit from foreign students in 2021-22 was estimated to be £41.9 billion.

item.title: Hurricane Ernesto Makes Landfall on Bermuda
item.description: The Category 1 storm made landfall early Saturday morning. It left hundreds of thousands of customers without power in Puerto Rico this week.

item.title: Ukraine Destroys Key Russian Bridge as It Presses On With Offensive
item.description: The bridge’s destruction is a setback for Russian supply lines as Ukraine seeks to consolidate its territorial gains in the Kursk region of western Russia.

item.title: A German diaspora in North Carolina is booming thanks to a multibillion-dollar investment from Germany, but a potential Trump Presidency is causing anxiety
item.description: Thousands of Germans have flocked to North Carolina in recent years, aided by investments from Siemens and Daimler.

item.title: ‘There Is No Childhood in Gaza’
item.description: A 9-year-old Palestinian boy lost his mother, father and two siblings in an Israeli airstrike early in the Gaza war. Within months, he, too, was killed.

item.title: ‘There Is No Childhood in Gaza’
item.description: A 9-year-old Palestinian boy lost his mother, father and two siblings in an Israeli airstrike early in the Gaza war. Within months, he, too, was killed.

item.title: Fired CFO’s texts revealed a 10-year affair that led to higher pay and promotions, company says
item.description: The bank launched an investigation in March after an anonymous whistleblower alleged that two executives had been seen “hugging and kissing and exiting the elevators” of a hotel near the office.

item.title: Kamala Harris and the Return of ‘Tough on Crime’
item.description: Over her career, her rhetoric has tracked the national mood. So do Americans now want a prosecutor-in-chief?

item.title: With Purple Gold and Bouncy Metal, a Canadian Chemist Shines on YouTube
item.description: Disillusioned with grad school, Nigel Braun dropped out to film chemistry videos in his parents’ garage in Montreal. Then millions began viewing his whimsical and occasionally dangerous experiments.

item.title: California Gov. Newsom signs 10 bills targeting flash mobs, theft, and smash-and-grab robberies
item.description: The issue hit a boiling point this year amid mounting criticism from Republicans and law enforcement.
